alert.note: Alert for Klamath (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 1:55AM PDT until May 01 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Sprague River near Beatty affecting Klamath County. For the Sprague River...including Beatty...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sprague River near Beatty. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding of structures along the Sprague River in the vicinity of Sprague River, Lone Pine, and down stream can be expected. Widespread agricultural flooding is likely in this area as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:52 AM PDT MOnday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:27 PM PDT Sunday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 8.4 feet early this evening. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 03/10/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1100 AM PDT.
